author: Manolitro
title: #28 Prohibida toda actividad al aire libre en Mallorca, epicentro de las tormentas: "Lo peor de la DANA está por llegar"
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#1](c1#c-1) no importa, es (de momento) actividad individual, no debería estar afectado pueden seguir jugando. Eso si, solo limitado a 4 guiris mirando
[#2](c2#c-2)
Siempre les quedará el consuelo de irse a Asturias de vacaciones.
Al pais vasco que no vayan pues no se folla, se come mal y está todo carisimo.
[#2](c2#c-2) Por una parte los aviones no pueden venir, pero los que estan tampoco pueden irse...:P
[#14](c14#c-14) Relacionada:
Boya en Dragonera registra el récord de temperatura del agua en el Mediterráneo (X) [#14](c14#c-14) una de las cosas más características del clima mediterráneo son los episodios de lluvias torrenciales al final del verano, aunque es verdad que tradicionalmente suceden en septiembre
Esta noticia ya era antigua cuando se ha enviado. La prohibición la mandaron ayer para el dia de hoy. De hecho la noticia lo deja claro:
Los efectos más adversos de la Depresión Aislada en Niveles Altos (DANA) que afecta a Baleares tendrán lugar en la isla de Mallorca desde las nueve de la mañana y hasta las 15:00 horas del jueves, 15 de agosto.
Las 15:00 del jueves 15 de agosto ya habian pasado a las 18:32 de hoy cuando se ha enviado

author: Steeven Occhipinti
title: Mercato Manchester City : C'est fait pour Omar Marmoush qui va rejoindre les Skyblues, la durée du contrat dévoilée
text:
Mercato Manchester City : C'est fait pour Omar Marmoush qui va rejoindre les Skyblues, la durée du contrat dévoilée
- Manchester City se montre très actif dans ce mercato hivernal.
- Les Skyblues vont récupérer Omar Marmoush.
- L'attaquant égyptien était en grande forme avec l'Eintracht Francfort.
Après une première partie de saison loin d'être brillante, Manchester City a décidé de frapper fort lors de ce mercato hivernal. Les Skyblues sont en passe de s'attacher les services d'Omar Marmoush. Le club mancunien aurait enfin trouvé un accord avec l'Eintracht Francfort.
Manchester City va réaliser l'un des gros coups de ce mercato hivernal ! L'arrivée d'Omar Marmoush chez les Skyblues ne semble plus faire le moindre doute. Selon les informations de Fabrizio Romano, le club mancunien aurait trouvé un terrain d'entente avec l'Eintracht Francfort. Le très fiable journaliste italien indique que l'attaquant égyptien paraphera un contrat de cinq ans avec l'écurie de Pep Guardiola.
Omar Marmoush est en pleine confiance
Lors de la première partie de saison, Omar Marmoush a fait très forte impression avec l'Eintracht Francfort. Le talent de 25 ans s'est offert 20 buts et 14 passes décisives, en seulement 26 matchs, toutes compétitions confondues. Pouvant jouer à la pointe de l'attaque ou sur les ailes, il sera un renfort de taille pour Pep Guardiola.
Ce n'est pas la seule recrue à prévoir chez les Cityzens durant ce mois de janvier. Abdukodir Khusanov devrait aussi s'engager avec Manchester City, alors que le club anglais travaille également pour les arrivées de Vitor Reis et Andrea Cambiaso.
RETROUVEZ LES DERNIÈRES ACTUS AUTOUR DE MANCHESTER CITY, LES RUMEURS DE TRANSFERTS ET LES DERNIÈRES NEWS

author: NBCPhiladelphia
title: 'Diversity is not illegal': Women in skilled trades brace for Trump's DEI rollbacks
text:
President Donald Trump’s moves to curtail DEI policies create a particularly fraught environment for women in skilled trades, advocates say.
President Donald Trump's executive orders repealing diversity, equity and inclusion policies could worsen workplace conditions for women in skilled trades, where harassment is common, tradeswomen leaders said.
This may be ‘the best advice I have ever received,' says CFP—and it can help you during March MadnessIn an interview with CNBC, McAfee said some of the women she has spoken with have faced overt incidents of harassment, often verbal, and sometimes of a sexual nature. She said a tradeswoman told her that a foreman hit her on the buttocks with a shovel in front of other workers.
," which rolled back an array of executive orders issued over the past 60 years intended to curtail discrimination, including those meant to bolster the Equal Employment Opportunity Act. A White House representative, in an email to CNBC, said,"Protecting the civil rights and expanding opportunities for all Americans is a key priority of the Trump Administration, which is why he took decisive actions to terminate unlawful DEI preferences in the federal government."
United States Latest News, United States Headlines
Similar News:You can also read news stories similar to this one that we have collected from other news sources.

Read more »

Read more »
USC scrubs DEI from some webpages as Trump cracks down on campus diversity programsAmid federal attacks on DEI programs, USC and other U.S. universities are removing several websites that refer to diversity, equity and inclusion.
Read more »
Trump’s media company defends its ‘diversity and inclusion’ policies as his administration dismantles DEIDonald Trump has made purging the government of diversity, equity and inclusion programs a top priority of his new administration, calling them “illegal” and “immoral.” But throughout his career Trump has espoused the opposite view and has often highlighted the importance of such initiatives in business.

author: @agensir
title: Pasqua: mons. Carboni (Oristano e Ales-Terralba), “la nostra speranza inizia dall’assenza in quel sepolcro vuoto” - AgenSIR
text: “Il mio augurio per tutti voi è che questa Pasqua di Resurrezione ci sorprenda, che nonostante talvolta si cammini al buio, questo non mortifichi il nostro desiderio di Dio e la speranza dell’incontro con il Signore, che sappiamo correre per ciò che dà senso alla nostra vita e infine aprirci al mistero di credere in lui: il Risorto!”. Così mons. Roberto Carboni, arcivescovo di Oristano e vescovo di Ales-Terralba, nel messaggio in occasione della Pasqua pubblicato da “Il nuovo cammino”. “Il nostro mondo vive, in questo tempo, ore di buio”, osserva il presule: “Trafitto dalla violenza della guerra, dagli interessi dei potenti, dall’inascoltato grido dei deboli, dei bambini, di chi non sa come e dove difendersi e proteggersi. C’è un immenso sepolcro che racchiude la terra, le speranze di pace, il desiderio di una vita migliore e degna…”. Ripercorrendo quello che hanno vissuto Maria di Magdala e gli apostoli la mattina di Pasqua, mons. Carboni: “Dopo il grande silenzio sulla croce, qui c’è un altro silenzio, quello della presenza: ‘Hanno portato via il Signore’. Le stesse domande agitano, oggi, il nostro cuore: Chi ci salverà? Chi ci darà speranza?”. “Spetta a noi cristiani – ammonisce l’arcivescovo – dire anche agli altri che la nostra speranza inizia dall’assenza in quel sepolcro vuoto dove risuona, però, la parola del Maestro: ‘Io Sono con voi tutti i giorni, sino alla fine del mondo’. Solo la certezza della profonda verità di queste parole, la certezza della fede, ci dà speranza, sicuri di non essere abbandonati e soli”. “L’annuncio della Resurrezione – prosegue mons. Carboni – ha una dinamica forte. Non ci permette di stare seduti, ma ci spinge ad annunciare, a portare agli altri la buona notizia”. “Siamo anche noi interrogati oggi su che cosa ha il potere di smuoverci, di farci correre. È la luce di una speranza che si accende e che ci dice che il Signore è ancora con noi, che ci accompagna, che ci guida e protegge”, spiega l’arcivescovo, evidenziando che – come successo ai discepoli dopo la Resurrezione – “adesso tocca a ognuno di noi fare un percorso, un cammino interiore, dal buio allo sguardo attento, alla sorpresa, alla fede…”. Pasqua: mons. Carboni (Oristano e Ales-Terralba), “la nostra speranza inizia dall’assenza in quel sepolcro vuoto” “Il mio augurio per tutti voi è che questa Pasqua di Resurrezione ci sorprenda, che nonostante talvolta si cammini al buio, questo non mortifichi il nostro desiderio di Dio e la speranza dell’incontro con il Signore, che sappiamo correre per ciò che dà senso alla nostra vita e infine aprirci al mistero di credere in lui: il Risorto!”. Così mons. Roberto Carboni, arcivescovo di Oristano e vescovo di Ales-Terralba, nel messaggio in occasione della Pasqua pubblicato da “Il nuovo cammino”.

author: Elizabeth Denslow, OTR/L
title: Can Semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy) or Tirzepatide (Mounjaro, Zepbound) Lower Stroke Risk?
text:
For stroke survivors, the road to recovery can feel uncertain—especially when living with other health challenges like type 2 diabetes and obesity. But new research offers hope: two widely used diabetes medications, semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy) and tirzepatide (Mounjaro, Zepbound), may do more than just manage blood sugar. They could also help protect the brain and reduce your risk of future strokes.
The Connection Between Stroke, Diabetes, and Obesity
If you’ve had a stroke and also live with diabetes or obesity, you’re not alone—and you’re not without risk. These conditions increase inflammation, damage blood vessels, and disrupt metabolism in ways that can lead to future strokes or even cognitive decline over time.
In fact:
- Obesity and excessive weight gain are the
leading risk factorsfor developing type 2 diabetes. - People with diabetes are
twice as likelyto have a stroke. - Obesity and diabetes both
increase the riskof developing dementia. - Stroke survivors with diabetes often face
slower recovery, poorer outcomes, and higher recurrence rates.
So, anything that can reduce stroke recurrence and protect the brain is worth attention.
What This New Study Found Between Semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy), Tirzepatide (Mounjaro, Zepbound), and Stroke Risk
A new cohort study published July 2025 in JAMA Network Open followed over 60,000 adults with both type 2 diabetes and obesity. Researchers compared those taking semaglutide or tirzepatide to others using different diabetes medications.
Here’s what they discovered:
- Those on semaglutide or tirzepatide had a:
- 37% lower risk of developing dementia
- 19% lower risk of having a stroke
- 30% lower risk of dying from any cause
That’s big news—especially for stroke survivors trying to stay ahead of the curve.
Why These Semaglutide or Tirzepatide Might Help Prevent Stroke
Semaglutide and tirzepatide belong to a class of drugs called GLP-1 receptor agonists. They are widely used among those with type 2 diabetes, and may also be prescribed for individuals managing both type 1 diabetes and obesity.
Originally created to help manage blood sugar, these drugs have become famous for supporting weight loss. But researchers are now discovering they might also protect the brain by:
- Reducing inflammation in the brain
- Improving blood vessel function
- Lowering oxidative stress
- Possibly slowing down the brain changes seen in Alzheimer’s disease
In animal studies, these medications have been shown to protect neurons, the cells responsible for memory and movement. That could explain the lower dementia risk seen in humans.
What It Means for Stroke Survivors
If you’re a stroke survivor with diabetes or obesity, this research might give you a new reason to talk to your doctor. These medications may offer:
- Protection against future strokes
- Better brain health over time
- A longer, healthier life
And the benefits seem to be strongest in:
- People over 60
- Women
- Those with a BMI between 30–40
These are all groups that face a higher baseline risk of dementia and stroke recurrence.
What About Parkinson’s or Brain Bleeds?
Interestingly, the study did not find a lower risk of Parkinson’s disease or brain hemorrhages (a type of stroke caused by bleeding). So while the protective effects may be strong for some brain conditions, they’re not universal.
Are These Medications Right for You?
Before making any changes to your treatment plan, consider these key points:
- They’re not for everyone. If you don’t have diabetes or aren’t overweight, these medications aren’t usually prescribed.
- Adverse side effects are possible. Some people experience nausea, stomach upset, or more serious complications.
- Cost and access vary. Insurance coverage and availability may affect your options.
But if you’re a stroke survivor managing type 2 diabetes or obesity, it’s worth having a conversation with your doctor about the potential long-term benefits.
Looking Ahead: Takeaway for Stroke Survivors
We’re still learning just how far these benefits go. More research is underway, including clinical trials looking at semaglutide’s role in preventing Alzheimer’s disease.
But for now, this study suggests something hopeful: medications originally designed for blood sugar and weight may be helping the brain—and reducing the chances of another stroke.
If you’ve had a stroke and are managing diabetes or obesity, you may be able to lower your risk of future strokes and dementia with the help of newer medications like semaglutide or tirzepatide.
Talk to your doctor. Ask questions. And keep building a care plan that supports your recovery—and your future.
Sources: Lin, H.-T., Tsai, Y.-F., Liao, P.-L., et al. “Neurodegeneration and Stroke After Semaglutide and Tirzepatide in Patients With Diabetes and Obesity.” JAMA Network Open. July 15, 2025.

author: Lisa Guinot
title: Dans le Périgord, un chiot abandonné sur un balcon par 0 degrés a été sauvé par les pompiers
text: Ce mercredi 10 janvier, les pompiers de Périgueux ont porté secours à un chiot âgé de seulement quelques mois. L’animal a été abandonné sur un balcon alors que les températures étaient proches de 0 degrés. En Nouvelle-Aquitaine, les pompiers de Périgueux sont intervenus pour une intervention pas comme les autres ce mercredi 10 janvier. En effet, un chiot âgé de 6 mois a été aperçu sur un balcon, livré à lui-même. Pendant toute la matinée, le petit chien est resté dehors et a aboyé pendant plusieurs heures, transi de froid. Il était bloqué au deuxième étage d’un immeuble, situé dans une rue passante du centre-ville, alors que la température extérieure avoisinait les 0 degrés et que la neige commençait à tomber. Cette scène inquiétante n’a pas échappé à Peggy Faure, l’assistante de communication du musée municipal d’art et d’archéologie du Périgord, situé en face du balcon en question. Alertée par la souffrance du chien, elle a décidé d’agir. “J’ai sonné dans cet immeuble où était ce chiot et je n’ai pas eu de réponse. Je me suis permise d’appeler le cabinet de la maire et la police municipale s’est déplacée. Il y avait une petite couverture qui pendait du balcon. Je me permets de dire que c’était intentionnel que ce chien soit sur ce balcon ! Ce n’était pas un accident. Dans un premier temps, j’ai pensé à mes propres animaux qui eux étaient bien au chaud à la maison et j’ai pleuré”, a confié Peggy Faure à [France Bleu](https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/faits-divers-justice/un-malinois-de-quatre-mois-laisse-sur-un-balcon-de-perigueux-par-00c-sauve-par-les-pompiers-3402871). Les pompiers sauvent le chiot Peggy Faure a donc fait un signalement auprès des services municipaux afin d’alerter Patrick Capet, l’élu en charge de la cause animale à Périgueux. Finalement, les pompiers de la ville sont intervenus avec leur grande échelle pour récupérer le chiot. “Il était transi de froid. La pauvre bête errait au milieu d’excréments”, a regretté Patrick Capet, selon des confidences rapportées par [Sud Ouest](https://www.sudouest.fr/dordogne/perigueux/un-chiot-transi-de-froid-coince-sur-un-balcon-sauve-par-les-sapeurs-pompiers-de-dordogne-18083259.php). Le petit chiot, un Malinois, a été sauvé par les pompiers et est désormais sain et sauf. Il a été confié à la SPA de Marsac. La présidente de l’association, Éliane Rigaud, a emmené le chiot chez un vétérinaire pour le faire vacciner et vérifier son état de santé. L’animal n’étant pas pucé ni tatoué, il est désormais la propriété de la SPA et va être proposé à l’adoption. De son côté, Éliane Rigaud a décidé de déposer une plainte contre le propriétaire du chien pour maltraitance animale. Mais l’histoire ne s’arrête pas là puisque pendant le sauvetage du chiot, les pompiers ont aperçu un autre chien à l’intérieur du logement. Ainsi, la présidente de la SPA compte entamer des recherches afin de récupérer ce chien.

author: Kevin S. Held
title: St. Louis man admits creating child abuse content with 8 victims
text:
ST. LOUIS – A St. Louis man appeared in federal court on Wednesday and admitted producing child sexual abuse material (CSAM) involving at least eight victims.
Prosecutors with the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of Missouri said Tracy Jenkins, 59, made videos of sexual abuse of minors and circulated that material online.
Jenkins admitted making videos as early as 2013. He admitted sexually abusing five children and recording the abuse. According to Jenkins’ plea agreement, at least three other victims have since been identified.
One of the victims was 6 years old when the abuse began, and another was 11. Prosecutors said Jenkins provided food, money, clothing, and other items to some of his victims.
The FBI previously stated that investigators first became aware of the videos in 2017 and had been working to identify the victims ever since. Other videos had been circulating online since at least 2022.
The FBI’s Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit successfully identified one of the victims and notified the St. Louis FBI office.
On Feb. 23, 2023, FBI agents received information about the identity and location of one of the victims. An interview with that individual led authorities to four other victims, all of whom identified Jenkins as the man who abused them over the years and recorded those encounters.
The following day, federal agents went to Jenkins’ home with a search warrant. They found a hard drive containing more than 200 videos that not only matched the videos found online but had other incidents with victims who had not yet been identified. Jenkins was taken into custody that day.
FBI agents also discovered a Sarsilmaz 9mm pistol in Jenkins’ home. The gun had been reported stolen in St. Louis County.
According to court documents, Jenkins has a prior conviction for misdemeanor sexual misconduct in a 1997 case in St. Louis City. As such, he’s barred from possessing a firearm.
Jenkins pleaded guilty to one count of production of child pornography and one count of being a felon in possession of a firearm.
Jenkins will be sentenced in December. The U.S. Attorney’s Office will ask the judge for a sentence of 40 years in federal prison.

organizations.name: fbi’s crimes against children and human trafficking unit

author: Agence QMI
title: L’héritière de L’Oréal devient la première femme à valoir 100 milliards $ | JDM
text: L’héritière de L’Oréal devient la première femme à valoir 100 milliards $ L’héritière du groupe français de beauté L’Oréal, Françoise Bettencourt Meyers, devient la première femme à valoir plus de 100 milliards $ US. • À lire aussi: [Un milliard de dollars par année sans rien avoir à faire](http://www.tvanouvelles.ca/2023/12/27/1-milliard-de-dollars-par-annee-sans-rien-avoir-a-faire) Sa valeur s’est envolée à 100,2 milliards $ US (135 milliards $ CA) jeudi, selon l’Index Bloomberg, tandis que les actions de l’entreprise atteignaient un record depuis 1998. Malgré ce montant exorbitant, la fortune de Mme Bettencourt demeure bien en dessous de celle de Bernard Arnault, fondateur français du groupe de luxe LVMH, qui trônait à la deuxième place de l’Indice Bloomberg des milliardaires mercredi soir, avec une valeur de 179 milliards $ US (236 milliards $ CA). Mme Bettencourt, âgée de 70 ans, est vice-présidente du conseil d’administration de L’Oréal, une entreprise à la renommée mondiale qui vaut 241 milliards d’euros (351 milliards $ CA). En tant que fille unique, Françoise Bettencourt Meyers tient sa fortune de sa mère, Liliane Bettencourt, décédée en 2017.
